greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest triangular number with n prime factors (counted with multiplicity).
link: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..51
example: a(3)=28 because 28 is a triangular number with 3 prime factors: 28 = 2*2*7.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Sep 13 2002
